title: 12th12^\text{th} 12th Root
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\sqrt [ 12 ]{ \\dfrac { 1 }{ 181398528 }  }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be written as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac { \\sqrt [ 12 ]{ A }  }{ B }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive integer, find the minimum value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A+B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem was created by "},{"type":"text","text":"José Carlos Pereira","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]}]}]}

title: 6 x 3 is divisible by (6 + 3)
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many unordered pairs "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(m,n)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are there, such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are "},{"type":"text","text":"coprime","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" positive integers less than 100, and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac{mn}{m+n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an integer?"}]}]}

title: Spot the mistake
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here's my attempt at proving that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In which step did I "},{"type":"text","text":"first","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" commit a flaw in my logic?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned}
1^2&=1\\
2^2&=2+2&\text{(2 times)}\\
3^2&=3+3+3&\text{(3 times)}
\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Step 1:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" For any positive integer:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2=x+x+\cdots+x\quad\quad\text{(x times)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Step 2:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" Now, differentiating with respect to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2x=1+1+\cdots+1\text{(x times)}. "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Step 3:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":"  Summing this up, we get    "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2x = x. "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Step 4:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" Dividing by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2 = 1. "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2) "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
The second step is violating the linearity principle of differentiation operator.The right side of the equation is dependent on variable x, so the diff cannot be applied to each individual x."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Hamza A – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" oops,i didn't notice that this question was edited "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Jase Jason – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" unless you interpret it that way,the step is wrong,but my main argument is that it doesn't make any sense for negative numbers "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Thomas Hesbach – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" Why did you represented the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1.5)^2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , as sum of 1.5 two times? Isn't that should be 1.5 times? "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Sachin Vishwakarma – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" I stated 1.5 squared is not, equal to the sum of 1.5 and 1.5. You misread my post "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            It is written x times x. It makes some sense that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1.5)^2 = 1.5 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  times  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1.5 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". So, it looks correct to me. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But you can't write it as a sequence of x.
So, this step should be written true for positive integers only. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Fun fact is that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1.5)^2 = "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" one times and a half times of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1.5 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" .
Resulting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1.5 * 1 + 1.5 *0.5 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
So , it looks true.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            also x times doesn't make sense unless x is a natural number,which makes the statement wrong

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            1.5squared does not equal 1.5+1.5 hence step 1 is wrong.  The result works only for positive integers.  Since the function's domain is not over a continuous set, differentiation is not defined.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            @Rajdeep Bharati is correct,the answer is (1) if he's asking for the first mistake

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Even the first step is wrong. You have written 'for any non-zero number'; but equation (1) is true for positive numbers only.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I agree with pankaj"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"X²= x+x+.....+x"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here the right side of the equation is dependent on variable x, not only for the value but also for the No. Of terms in the equation. ( i.e X*X)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So if we differentiate only it's individual terms then it ll be like considering the equation to be  x*1 ..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So we have to differentiate it again and add (same like a differentiation of multiplication) "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2x = (1+1+...+1) (1) + (1) (1+1+...+1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2x = x + x"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2x = 2x"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: Do it without diagram!
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In triangle "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB = BC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\angle B = 20^\\circ"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AM : MC = 1 : 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the projection of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BM"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\angle AHB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in degrees."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Lets assume the mid point of AC is D. Then BHDC is cyclic quad. And hence MD.MC = MH.MB 
Lets assume AM = X, Then MC = 2X, MD = 3X/2. - X = X/2
We THEN have MD.MC = X² = AM^2 or  AM² = MD.MC = MH.MB
Thus MA is tangential to the circum-circle of Tr. AHB and thus /"},{"type":"text","text":"ABH = /","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"HAM which makes /_AHB=100°."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Make sure your notation doesn't do double duty: "Lets assume the mid point of AC is M.". But M is already a point on AC such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" AM : MC = 1: 2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I think you swapped notation, where M in the question is your Q, and you defined a new M. This makes reading the solution somewhat confusing. Can you make the corresponding edits?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@One Top"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/ajit-sjyz18/"}]},{"type":"text","text":",  One thing more, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"what if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" lies outside the triangle? Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BHDC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not cyclic?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Please tell what to do.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            You have given the vertex angle as 20° and the base angles as 80° each. In such a triangle H can only be within the triangle.  Would that be right?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Let's say we have a flat isosceles triangle in which B is obtuse. Now it's possible for H to be outside triangle ABC. The entire figure now changes but BHCD is still cyclic and it can be very easily seen that /- ABH = 90° + B/2. Remember this is /-ABH and not /-AHB.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many 3 digit numbers are multiples of 13?"}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many of the following statements are false?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A: There is 1 statement here which is false."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B: There are 2 statements here which are false."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C: There are 3 statements here which are false."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D: There are 4 statements here which are false."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E: There are 5 statements here which are false."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Easy!!!!!!","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The false of the statements is in the writing. B - E are false because on the place of "is" must be "are"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 130th Problem 2016
1, 3, 1+3, 13, what's next?
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let a and b be two constants such that ax + by = 1, a"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"+ b"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" =3, a"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + b"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 4, a"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + b"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 13 and a"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" + b"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = m/n where m and n are coprime positive integers. What is m+n?"}]}]}
